intro: Sutherlandia frutescens var. microphylla, commonly known as cancer bush or kaffir dock, is a small, shrub-like plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional African medicine. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland and rocky habitats. Its unique appearance and potential health benefits make it a notable species in the botanical world.
